title: 109_s2614
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006". It pertains to alternative energy refueling systems. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, which are used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include definitions for alternative energy refueling systems, used to refuel vehicles with compressed natural gas, E-85 ethanol, specified fuels under the Internal Revenue Code, or other alternative fuels as determined by the Administrator. Eligible entities include refueling vendors or owners/operators. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities, such as refueling vendors, to receive Trust Fund reimbursement for purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems. The Administrator will establish a reimbursement program for eligible entities to receive Trust Fund reimbursement for purchasing and installing alternative energy refueling systems by submitting an application with required information. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for installing alternative energy refueling systems within 30 days of verification. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for installing operational alternative energy refueling systems, with limitations on receiving dual benefits. The Administrator will reimburse eligible entities for installing alternative energy refueling systems, but they cannot receive reimbursement if the cost was already considered for a tax credit. The eligible entity can receive reimbursement for up to 2 alternative energy refueling systems per facility, with a limit on the amount provided for each system. The reimbursement for an alternative energy refueling system shall not exceed 30% of the cost or $30,000, with a limit of 2 systems per facility. The Administrator shall not use Trust Fund funds obligated for other projects or activities under this subsection for alternative energy refueling systems exceeding 30% of the cost or $30,000. The Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act of 1986 and the Alternative Energy Refueling System Act of 2006 amended Section 9508(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment clarified obligations of owners or operators to comply with provisions of the subtitle.
